org.eclipse.scada.core

Class Variant

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.scada.core.Variant
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Variant>

    public class Variant
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Variant>
    A variant data type that can hold any scalar value type.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • asBoolean

        public boolean asBoolean()
        Get the value as boolean value If the value is null then false is returned. If the value is a boolean it will simply return the value itself. If the value is a numeric value (double, long, integer) is will return false if the value zero and true otherwise. If the value is a string then false is returned if the string is empty. If the string can be converted to a number (long or double) it will be compared to that number. Otherwise it will be compared case insensitive against the string 
         true
        .
        Returns:
        The boolean value of this variant

      • asBoolean

        public java.lang.Boolean asBoolean(java.lang.Boolean defaultValue)
        Parameters:
        defaultValue - the default value
        Returns:
        the value as a boolean or the default value if the value is null
        Since:
        0.15.0

      • as

        public java.io.Serializable as(VariantType variantType,
                      java.io.Serializable defaultValue)
        Convert the variant to a java object of the type specified by the variantType parameter

        The default value must be of the type of the variant type parameter, otherwise a class cast exception will be thrown. The default value may also be null.

        Parameters:
        variantType - the variant type to convert to (may be null)
        defaultValue - the default value in case the conversion fails or the variant is NULL
        Returns:
        the resulting java object
        Since:
        0.16.0
        See Also:
        as(VariantType)

      • as

        public java.io.Serializable as(VariantType variantType)
                        throws NullValueException,
                               NotConvertableException
        Convert the variant to a java object of the type specified by the variantType parameter

        The method converts the current variant to a plain java Serializable of the requested type. For the list of types than can be expected see the java type field of VariantType.

        There are some special cases for this method:

        • If the parameter variantType is null the java object currently set will be returned without any conversion
        • If the variant type VariantType.UNKNOWN is requested the java object currently set will be returned without any conversion
        • If the VariantType.NULL is requested always null will be returned

        Parameters:
        variantType - the target type
        Returns:
        the resulting java object
        Throws:
        NullValueException - in case the variant was of type null and should be converted to some other type
        NotConvertableException - in case the variant cannot be converted to the target value
        Since:
        0.16.0

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Get the string representation of the variant (not the variant value). This includes also the variant type.

        The format is VariantType#VariantValue.

        If you want to get the string representation of the variant value itself use asString() instead.

        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • getType

        public VariantType getType()
